title: On selling an article for Rs. 105, a trader loses 9%. At how much should he sell the article to gain 30%? - Quora

response.answer_text: Answer: The trader should sell the article at Rs 150/- Solution: Let ‘x’ be the cost of an article. x - x(9/100) = 105 => x(1–0.09) = 105 => x(0.91) = 105 => x = 105/(0.91) Let ‘y’ be the sale price of the same article in order to gain 30%. y = x + x(30/100)= x (1 + 0.3) = x (1.3) = (105/0.91)(1.3) = (136.5) / (0.91) = 150

Loss and profit are calculated on C.P So if S.P= Rs 105 , then based on info in question, we get Loss =C.P-S.P= 9% of C.P Or C.P-105=9%of C.P Or 91%of C.P=Rs 105 Or C.P= Rs 105 x 100/91 Now to gain 30% profit Required S.P= C.P+ Profit = C.P+ 30% of C.P =130% of C.P = 130/100x C.P={ 130/100× 105×100/91)} =Rs 150
